definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: Sky gradually dim, empty river Piaoqi the thick strands of rain drift.
sentences.chinese: 天色漸漸暗淡，空曠的河面飄起了密密的雨絲。

sentences.english: Through the strands of rain drift, she quietly watching from afar.
sentences.chinese: 透過雨絲，她靜靜地望着遠方。

sentences.english: The rain falls, and something happens.
sentences.chinese: 雨絲飄落下來了，奇妙的事發生了。

sentences.english: I can see drizzle from a leaden sky.
sentences.chinese: 我可以看見從鉛灰色的天空中飄落的雨絲。

sentences.english: Floating down the rain down, there is green dill growing in air.
sentences.chinese: 順着雨絲飄下的，還有凌空生長的綠蘿。

sentences.english: The cold rain started sometime during the night. It came down through the cracks.
sentences.chinese: 晚上開始下雨，冰冷的雨絲從裂縫中灑下來。

sentences.english: We might even forget the color of the sky, the smell of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 我們甚至可能會忘記了天空的顏色，雨絲的氣味。

sentences.english: Let the past gone with the wind and look for a brand-new start.
sentences.chinese: 思緒隨着雨絲飄得很遠，讓往事隨風，追尋新的開始。

definition: to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
Baqiao District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
(bird species of China) Eurasian jackdaw (Coloeus monedula)
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
